title.narrative: Chafumbwa and Upper Makwangwala Water and Sanitation Project

description.narrative: The action will improve the situation through increased access to safe water from the current 31% coverage to 90% coverage, Increase access to improved sanitation from 5.5% to 75% in the villages, reduce the ratio of pupil to improved latrine from over 162 pupils to less 60 pupils per latrine in line with government standards. It will also improve access to hygiene messages, peoples knowledge on HIV/AIDS, gender, human rights, environment leading to improved health and socio-economic status

participating-org.narrative: European Commission - Directorate-General for International Partnerships (INTPA)

organisation.narrative: Delegation of the European Union to Malawi

department.narrative: Delegation of the European Union to Malawi

description.narrative: Traditional Authority Chafumbwa in Dedza District and Traditional Authority Makwangwala in Ntcheu District - Malawi

sector.narrative: Basic drinking water supply and basic sanitation

description.narrative: Reported results indicators by the European Commission ¿ International Cooperation and Development (DEVCO) may not represent the complete set of indicators monitored for the project. The results are reported using a contribution approach. This means that where a project has been financed by the EU jointly with other funders ¿ such as partner country governments or other donors ¿ the overall outputs of the collective effort are reported rather than outputs attributed to the share of funding provided by the EU. For higher levels of results, such as outcomes and impacts, the project will only have contributed to the overall effort.
